item.title: Documenting HTTP requests with Hurl
item.description: I don’t really remember anymore how I stumbled upon Hurl but nevermind that, it looks awesome! It’s basically a wrapper around cURL that allows you to write a handful of HTTP requests into a single plaintext file and execute them. You can then add assertions for responses and also pass data from one response to follow-up requests.
item.author: (Horst Gutmann, software engineer from Graz, Austria.)

item.author: (Brian Di Croce)

item.title: Empowering teams are like career accelerators
item.description: I follow several technical people whose stances on tech I can identify with in a few platforms, and, by far, Gergely Orosz has been one of the most influential people I’ve decided to follow, and, I’m glad I did! As a former Uber manager his posts and insights are always extremely interesting to read. Some of the topics are geared towards senior ICs or people who are on track to become managers or who have more people responsibilities than a standard IC, but, at least recently, I’ve found for myself that you can always take away something valuable from such articles, even if you aren’t yet at that level. This is a bit in-line with the Stackoverflow article about growing by doing stretch assignments.
item.author: (Bruno Oliveira)
